title: Fuel Tank - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
If removed, refit the rear fuel tank bracket to the fuel tank and tighten the fixings to
Position the fuel tank to the frame aligning the rear bracket over the stop screws.
Refit the rear bracket front and rear bracket rear fixings to the frame, do not fully tighten at this stage.
Rear bracket front fixing (left hand shown)
Rear bracket rear fixing (left hand shown)
With the aid of an assistant. align the fuel tank above its mountings to connect the fuel hoses and electrical connectors.
With the aid of an assistant raise the fuel tank.
Connect the fuel hose by squeezing the sides of the connector and pushing the hose onto the spigot.
Position the connector and lock onto the spigot.
Connect the keyless fuel cap electrical connection (white).
Connect the fuel level sender electrical connection (black).
Connect the fuel pump electrical connection (brown).
Connect the fuel tank drain hose.
Fuel tank drain hose (internal diameter 5 mm)
Make sure the fuel drain tube is not trapped when lowering the fuel tank.
A damaged or trapped fuel drain tube will cause fuel to leak.
A fuel leak can result in a fire causing damage to property and injury to persons.
Make sure the evaporative hose is not trapped when lowering the fuel tank.
A damaged evaporative hose may cause the evaporative system to become blocked.
Damaged or trapped hoses may cause the engine to lose power leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Before disconnection, note that the EVAP hose has a 7 mm internal diameter and the fuel tank drain hose a 5 mm internal diameter.
Make sure they are returned to the same locations when refitting the fuel tank.
Refit the 20Amp fuse PS#5 to the fuse box and close the lid.
Make sure the fuel hose is not trapped between the fuel tank seam and rear sub frame.
A damaged fuel hose may cause reduced fuel pressure or a fuel leak.
Trapped fuel hoses may cause the hose to split , causing a fire and personal injury and damage to property.
The fuel hose has different coloured connectors on each end, to aid orientation. The orange end must be fitted to the fuel tank, the grey end must be fitted to the fuel rails.
Check the hoses and connectors are not trapped or kinked.
Position the fuel hose so that the curve follows the route shown making sure there are no kinks or twists and the rubber straps are positioned as noted during removal.
Fuel tank drain hose (internal diameter 5 mm)
Lower the front of the fuel tank.
If removed, refit the front fuel tank bracket to the fuel tank and tighten the fixings to
Fit the fuel tank bracket fixings to the frame and tighten to
Fit the front fixings to both sides of the rear bracket.
Tighten the rear bracket front and rear fixings to
Rear bracket front fixing (left hand shown)
Rear bracket rear fixing (left hand shown)
If the battery has been removed, refit the battery into it's case. do not reconnect the battery terminals at this stage.
If removed, refit the battery in to the case.
Secure the battery negative lead to the main harness conduit with the omega clip.
Rear bracket front fixing (right hand shown)
Rear bracket rear fixing (left hand shown)
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.
Using proprietary professional automotive workshop equipment approved for fuel handling, refill the fuel tank with the fuel previously removed.
Start the engine and check carefully for fuel leaks. Rectify as necessary.

Perform the following operations:
Seats - Installation
